div.sent: The very word,Tiratana means Triple-gems, i.e. the combination of three gems.
In Buddhism it bears a separate meaning.
Here the Triratnas are the Buddha ratna, the Dharma ratna and the Sangha ratna respectively.
These three ratnas are collectively known as the Triple-gems.
In Buddhism the Triple-gems possess a great significance.
The worship of the Triple- gems is the first step for entrance into Buddhism.
To be well aware of Buddhism everybody should know about the Triple-gems and its significance.
The Buddha is the first gem of the Triple-gems.
The word Buddha means wise.
The Buddha was more specifically the wisest of all.
He became the Buddha performing a great deal of meditation in the present and previous lives.
He was the man of profound wisdom.
So He is the greatest gem.
We pay our tribute to the Buddha with great respect and honour.
We praise for His wisdoms and virtues.
All our praise for His wisdom and virtues are known as the worship of the Buddha.
The Dhamma indicates to hold something.
The preceptors of the different ages proclaimed their doctrines for the welfare of all human beings.
The proclamation of the teachings of those great men is known as the Dhamma.
The Buddha preached His doctrine possessing the Noble Eightfold path.
The doctrine proclaimed by the Buddha is known as Buddhism all over the world.
This very doctrine of the Buddha is the Dhamma ratna.
Thus praising the qualities of the Dhamma is known as the worship of the Dhamma.
The Sangha means association of people.
In Buddhism all Bhikkhus (monks) who have renounced family bondage are collectively known as the Bhikkhu Sangha.
They are called Sangha ratna.
They follow the rules set by the Buddha and dedicate themselves for the propagation of Buddhism.
They are respected by all.
To pay tribute to the Sangha is called the Sangha Vandana i.e. the worship of the Sangha.
In fact the Buddha is the symbol of perfect knowledge or wisdom.
The Dhamma is the symbol of purity and virtuousness and the Sangha is the symbol of unity.
Thus it is found that the Buddha advised the people to earn wisdom practicing virtuousness and upholding unanimity.
While performing the prayer some rules are to be followed.
At the outset one should take refuge to the Tripple-gems by kneeling before the Buddha image with folded hands.
Tisarana means to show respect having full faith in the Buddha, Dhamma and Sangha.
The worship to the Triple-gems aims at the effort of reflecting the part of unlimited virtues in one's life.
Worship to the Triple-gems purifies the mind.
Mental unrest is removed and it helps to earn the virtues peacefully.
By dint of worship man never goes to hell rather ascends to heaven after death.
He is not afraid of ghosts or evils.
Taking refuge to the Triple- gems is much more effective than offering the monastery even.
The Noble Eightfold path is the easiest way to attain Nibbana.
This is the Dhamma, the greatest by virtues and tranquilities.
Do I pay my humble homage to this Dhamma, the most sophisticated one.
The Triple-gems have their respective virtues.
Such as the Buddha possesses nine, the Dhamma six and the Sanha nine kinds of qualities respectively.
I go to the Buddha, the virtuous forever as my refuge.
Do I pay my homage to all the Buddhas of the past, present and future.
Have I got no other refuge excepting the Buddha, the Enlightened One.
Do I bow down my head to the Buddha, the fully awakened One.
Oh the Buddha, please forgive me if I do any wrong to you out of ignorance.
Well taught is the teaching of the Blessed One, of immediate advantage, timeless, inviting to experience, leading onward, to be known individually by the wise.
I go to the most virtuous Dhamma forever as my refuge.
Do I pay my homage to the Dhamma of the past, present and future.
Have I got no refuge other than the Dhamma.
Might this true utterance bring me success and happiness.
Do I bow down my head as refuge to the Dhamma that possessed divine qualities.
May the Dhamma forgive me if ever I do any wrong out of ignorance.
Do I pay my homage to the Sangha forever.
Do I worship the Sangha of the past, present and future.
Have I got no refuge other than the most virtuous Sangha.
May this true utterance bring me success and happiness.
